catalog_info.title: The Pleasures of Japanese Poetry: Reading, Writing, and Translation
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Reads classical waka, its modern descendant the tanka, and examples of linked verse (renga) and modern poems in free and prose-poem forms. (And haiku too!) Focuses on themes such as desire, renunciation, time, memory, war, death, sorrow, and receptivity. Students keep a diary of their encounters with the new poetry, practice the art of sequencing, and make their own translations based on literal renderings and explanations of Japanese originals.
